metadata.Title: CVE-2022-37290 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GNOME Nautilus 42.2 allows a NULL pointer dereference and get_basename application crash via a pasted ZIP archive.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37290` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-nautilus-3.0 - 1:3.36.3-0ubuntu1.20.04.2
libnautilus-extension1a - 1:3.36.3-0ubuntu1.20.04.2
nautilus - 1:3.36.3-0ubuntu1.20.04.2
nautilus-data - 1:3.36.3-0ubuntu1.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: caja package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
nautilus package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.36.3-0ubuntu1.20.04.2').
nemo package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
